item.title: Puzzles #4 (heyawake x2)
item.description:
https://puzz.link/p?heyawake/19/15/201480mhg2i40a8s192816704r503gk0m2g2oa0a18085010k046g0003hu0104000400fbvgvo005fu1800o0000000800600000003s0003c-1c140411g81ah8233 https://puzz.link/p?-610190g51011103131345g34356
I made these puzzles to demonstrate how "penalty theory" in Heyawake can be applied locally. The first can be solved with standard deductions somewhat painfully, so to fix that I made the second one, which definitely requires penalty theory to be solved by a human (and is quite an interesting design in its own right).

A triplet with varying forms of symmetry! It's hard to make a Tatebo-Yokobo with nontrivial logic, so these difficulty ratings are relative to the type. It's especially hard with symmetry and theme constraints, but I did my best with these.Thanks a ton to @lovemathboy for testing these (and notifying me two were broken)!
